intro: Pelargonium theianthum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, adding vibrant color to gardens in its native habitat.
